span.a: Find Out How To Get Your Alternative Teaching Certification HERE!

p.span: MISSION: The mission of the Nicholas County School system is - educating students for success in life.
BELIEFS: The Nicholas County Board of Education believes that the mission can be achieved through the collective efforts of students, parents and guardians, educators and the community.
The goals of the Nicholas County Schools system are to:
2) provide a safe and healthful learning environment that promotes citizenship, wellness, self-discipline, personal responsibility, and character; and

3) prepare all students to be successful after high school graduation.
As required by federal laws and regulations, the Nicholas County Board of Education does not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, religion, disability, age and national origin in employment and in the administration of any of its education programs and activities. Inquiries may be directed to Melissa Adkins, Title IX Coordinator, Section 504 Coordinator, Nicholas County Board of Education, 400 Old Main Drive, Summersville, WV 26651. Telephone (304) 872-3611, or to the U.S. Department of Education’s Director of the Office for Civil Rights (215) 596-6793.
